explanation: The wording of the brain teaser indicates that Mr. and Mrs. Mustard have six daughters, and each daughter has one brother. This means that all six daughters share the same single brother. Therefore, the family consists of two parents (Mr. and Mrs. Mustard), six daughters, and one brother, totaling 9 members in the family.

The brain teaser plays with the meanings of the words used. The woman 'shooting' her husband refers to taking a photograph, not harming him. The act of holding the photograph underwater refers to the developing process, and hanging him simply refers to hanging the developed photo to dry. Therefore, they both go out for dinner afterward without any harm done.
The reason not a single hair on his head got wet is that the man is bald. Since he has no hair, there's no hair that could get wet despite being soaked by the rain.

The first option explains that two girls share one apple, which means both girls get an equal portion of the apple and thus all five girls receive an apple in some form, while the remaining apple stays in the basket, satisfying the condition of the brain teaser.

Sliding a newspaper under a door allows Tom and his sister to stand on opposite sides, preventing them from touching while still being on the same piece of newspaper. This solution effectively meets the requirement of them standing together without physical contact.

The horse can eat the hay because the rope is not tied to anything else, allowing him to walk freely and reach the hay ten meters behind him. The problem does not specify that the rope has to be tied to an immovable object, thus making this option the most logically sound.
